intro: Schefflera caroli, commonly known as the Caroli's umbrella plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, umbrella-shaped compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Schefflera caroli thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ease of care.
